One of the best single player games I have ever played. Ever Ever Ever! A game that I completed several times because the story and level design are so devastatingly good. The opening level in Columbia is mind blowing, I could walk hours in it exploring the city. The story alone deserves an award, let alone you being able to walk through it. 

A must play and well worth the money, especially for a single player game!
Had it on Xbox, didnt complete so it was a bargain on PC/Mac - Incredible storyline and amazing gameplay!
Игра поразившая своей глубиной. Это все равно что "всматриваться в бездну", в то время, как она будет всматриваться тебя и задевать все глубже и глубже.

This games is so linear and trite much like moving through the writers colon.  They tell you what character to like and dislike, the graphics are poor just hidden behind special effects. Oh wow fog motion blur and HDR!  You can't go anywhere that isn't on a pre determind route and gameplay is tedious and annoying.  Overly elaborate weapons (think transformers) with way too many large effects coupled with fog motion bluer pointless camera shake followed by enemys the size of ants who cant miss with endless vollys of RPGs and SMG fire. Pointless powerups and the woman is involved somewhat but doesn't effect the outcome at all so might as well be a sandwich. (Why is a girl who cant leave the house for 20 years and only reads not half blind and fat?)  BORING!
One of the best modern RPGs. It's a must play. I can recomment this game to everyone.
Litterally the best game i have ever played.

Ein Wort: Unglaublich!
Die Story ist packend, die Stadt wirkt sehr lebendig, die Musik ist hinterlegt die Atmosphäre perfekt, Charaktere werden mit reichlich Hintergrundinformationen eingebracht und die Kämpfe mit den soganannten Skylines sind bombastisch, ich kann mich wirklich nicht daran erinnern, jemals so viel Spaß in einem Shooter gehabt zu haben.
Natürlich bleibt dieses Spiel nicht ohne Manko, obwohl ich gerade die Kämpfe mit den Skylines gen Himmel gelobt habe, sind die Gefechte ohne diese spaßigen schwebenden Schienen leider nur durchschnittlich. Natürlich gibt es einige Waffen, welche sich auch relativ gut und nützlich anfühlen, die Kräfte sind ebenfalls wundervoll in die Scene gesetzt, dennoch ist die Shooter-Mechanik nicht auf dem Level, wie manch andere aktuelle FPS, dies liegt eventuell auch an der gewöhnungsbedürftigen Steuerung(bis ich bemerkt habe, das ich mit dem Mausrad ja auch zielen kann).
Diese Kritik ist jedoch keineswegs ein Grund diese Spiel(insbesondere als Sale für weniger als 10€!) zu kaufen, denn dieses Spiel ist einfach grandios!

Alle Daumen hoch, das Spiel macht einfach nur mega Laune und das beste an allem man muss seine Begleitung nicht babysitten (siehe Resident Evil 4)...
Einziger kleiner Kritikpunkt ist, das auf der schwersten Stufe eine Stellen einfach zu schwer sind, im Verhältnis zum größten Teil der Kämpfe
dgyj
10/10 would play.
Fantastic game. Play it like there is no tomorrow. haha

Good start, good end. And these are the bits when you're not shooting anyone.
Everything in between is an archaic FPS full of design decisions that distract you from anything that the game is doing well. Having to search every crate instead of looking at the scenery; fetch quest progression and bad pacing in some of the later skirmishes. Took me around 14 hours because some points are so padded out and artificially lengthened, making it a bit of a chore by the end.

3/5 because I enjoyed the few moments of heartfelt interaction it provided me.
Truly amazing gameplay and storytelling - deserving of Game Of The Year if you ask me..

I played BioShock 2 last summer after hearing rave reviews for the BioShock series and was unimpressed. A few months ago, my friend let me borrow his PS3 copy of BioShock Infinite, which included the first game on the disc. I played through BioShock, and it was pretty fun, but I don't think it deserves a Metascore of 96. Then I played BioShock Infinite, and what I got was completely unexpected. But before I get into why I like the game, I want to get the rest of it out of the way. I really enjoyed the first playthrough, but I didn't want to keep it from my friend too long so I gave it back. When the Steam Winter sale rolled along, I saw this game was on sale for $10 and the season pass was only $5. Since I wasn't able to play the DLC on a borrowed copy, I decided to buy it for myself on PC along with the season pass. I was not impressed with the visuals of the PS3 version, but the lighting and water effects on the PC version are fantastic. Now the actual game... The gameplay is great, but what really shines in Infinite is the story. It's not too short and not too long, taking me 8 hours to beat (on my second playthrough), but the developers really focused on quality over quantity. The ending of the game is beyond description. It is the best ending I have ever seen in a video game, even better than Portal 2's ending. It not only surpasses Portal 2's ending, it blows it away. Even though I had already finished it, I beat the game earlier today, and I was just lying down trying to fall asleep and all I could think about was the fantastic ending. I guess now I am going to start playing the DLC. Here's hoping that has a great ending, too.
Edit: I just finished Burial at Sea Episode One and the ending was amazing.

Brilliant presentation, mediocre gameplay, badly written storyline.

All style and no substance. The story consists of plot twists for no reason other than to have plot twists, regardless of the mess it makes of the narrative, or what messages it ends up conveying. One character has the special ability to literally tear holes in the plot. As the "alternate universes" angle comes in, any reason to care about the characters goes out the window - if they're all alternate versions, with alternate realities, why care about any of them? Why is one reality/timeline objectively better, or more valid, than any other? 

On top of that, the gameplay is frankly boring. It does absolutely nothing to advance the shooter genre - on the contrary it's bland and derivative. 

It is VERY pretty though, I'll give it that.

------SPOILERS BELOW------

When I say "The story consists of plot twists for no reason other than to have plot twists, regardless of the mess it makes of the narrative, or what messages it ends up conveying" I'm referring to the Vox Populi turning on you.

The game starts out with the premise that you're fighting against some really awful people, really vile racists and bigots. By introducing the plot twist that you must now fight the Vox Pop, though the developers almost certainly did not intend it, what their game is now saying is "You know who the REAL evil people are? They're not really the oppressors, they're the downtrodden minorities!" It's an absurd position to take, and it's an absurd situation to be in. There is no justification for having to fight the people you've been fighting to save, other than it being a hackneyed "shocking" plot twist just for the sake of having a plot twist.

You can tell that at least one person at 2K had an inkling that this might be the case because before you have to fight them the Vox Pop are mostly black folks, but you only ever fight Irish folks. You can tell because it would make the offensive absurdity of the situation starkly obvious if the second half of the game was all about massacring black people!

"Fuck minorities, up with Whitey" obviously wasn't what 2K had in mind when they set out to make this game. But because whoever wrote the plot didn't stop and think that is what their creation says.

Then there's simple, silly things it does to the plot. We jump through a portal into an alternate universe after failing to save the weapons dealer. Ok, so how does it help anything at all to defeat Comstock in this new universe? We've still left behind a universe where he wins. Why is this new universe objectively any different?

Why does Booker ultimately drowning himself change anything at all? He's just ONE iteration of Booker; why does the death of that universe's Booker have any impact on any others?
Отличная игра
Graphics are amazing and the story is indepth and latches onto you until you complete the game.

Você nota que o jogo é uma obra prima quando seus defeitos são praticamente obliterados por sua grandiosidade e qualidade.
O gameplay pode se tornar massante e cansativo em diversos momentos do jogo, mas a força da narrativa e o desenvolvimento dos personagens te fazem ignorar essa pequena falha rumo a um dos melhores finais (se não o melhor) da história dos jogos.

A direção de arte do jogo é juntamente com a de Dishonored (que teve claras influências no próprio Bioshock) a melhor dos últimos anos. Não posso dizer que Columbia é visualmente mais interessante que Rapture, mas é algo que você definitivamente não vai esquecer tão cedo. Os gráficos caricatos também agradam muito e fazem parte da identidade visual tão marcante do jogo.

Não há como negar que Bioshock Infinite é mais um grande marco dessa já quase encerrada geração.

I have play Bioshock on Xbox 360 and it was great but playing it on Mac is very rewarding, especially when i can play it in 1080p. The game visually is so immersive sucks me right in to the game even though i played it already. I also went ahead and bought the dlc...all i can say is Rapture is looking amazing!!!!!

Очень и очень плохой пример того, что бывает, когда идет погоня за массовым покупателем. С каждой частью серии игры становилась все более и более простой и от того скучной.
Я не буду сейчас вспоминать System Shock, с которого всё начиналось. Хотя даже по сравнению с System Shock 2 первая часть Биошока была очень сильно упрощена по геймплейной составляющей.
Первый Биошок был отличен, хороший сюжет, хорошая визуальная составляющая, замечательный геймдизайн.
Второй Биошок тоже был неплох, но его делала другая студия, так что к ней я претензий предъявить не могу. Этот все тот же Биошок, просто у авторов было слегка другое видение, сюжетно она мне даже больше первой понравилась.
Ну и наконец последний Биошок - отличный геймдизайн, сносная визуальная составляющая, неплохой сюжет, но просто ОТВРАТИТЕЛЬНЫЙ геймплей.
Да, он именно отвратителен - FOV очень маленький, то бишь обзор перед собой представляет лишь узкий конус. Враги очень тупые, просто сами подставляются под хедшоты, какой-то интерес представляют только вОроны да силачи. Город наводнен плазмидами-тониками, а кроме парочки видов врагов их никто не использует.
Ты просто идешь и стреляешь вперед - очень сильно в этом плане игра напоминает КоД. Зажал W+ЛКМ=Win.
В неё просто СКУЧНО играть. И это обидно, потому что отличный геймдизайн и подача сюжета угроблены отвратительным геймплеем. Даже пресловутый "1999" режим не спасает ситуацию.

What can I say! A great sequel to Bioshock 2, expanding on many areas. Great visuals, lots of exploration, and generally a lot to do. If you are into rich, long and interesting storylines, this game is for you. The one complaint I have is the lack of variation in combat. It gets repetative sometimes. Other than that, AMAZING game!

A fine successor to the first two Bioshock games. Bioshock Infinite combines stunning visual scenery with an atmospheric sound track and intelligent script writing. The story contains powerful moral choices that have emotional impact without forcing them down your throat. I've enjoyed every second of it.
a must play

Um jogão! Um fps indispensável pra quem curte o genero. Algo que me agradou foi as expressões da Elizabeth em várias situações. Diferente de muitos jogos onde os personagens tem um ótimo design mas são totalmente sem emoção. A história que é meio confusa, ao ponto de quase fazer sua cabeça explodir quando você junta as peças. Mas essa é a ideia. Muito bom! Quem puder, jogue.

While the original titles of the series possessed the ability to create an engrossing world, clever plot, and involve simple, entertaining game mechanics, this title suffers from its inability to make Columbia living world, incapacity to create a plot that doesn't involve unexplained mechanics or outright contradictory decisions from characters, and game mechanics that are overl simpified to please the console market. For players who enjoyed the original titles, this WILL NOT be a revist to a succesful formula, but a repackaging of an old, tired, and unentertaining platter of forgettable places, frustrating mechanics, and foolish attempts at immersion.
